citation.article-title: Taxonomic study of the genus Salinicola: transfer of Halomonas salaria and Chromohalobacter salarius to the genus Salinicola as Salinicola salarius comb. nov. and Salinicola halophilus nom. nov., respectively
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Salinicola halophilus nom. nov.
Salinicola halophilus (ha.lo.phi′lus. Gr. n. halos salt; Gr. adj. philos loving; N.L. masc. adj. halophilus salt loving).
Basonym: Chromohalobacter salarius Aguilera et al. 2007.
The description is the same as that for Chromohalobacter salarius (Aguilera et al., 2007), with the following additions.
Exopolysaccharide is not produced.
Poly-β-hydroxyalkanoate is not produced.
Respiration on fumarate, nitrate and nitrite is negative.
Glucose is fermented.
Tween 20 is hydrolysed.
DNA is not hydrolysed.
β-Galactosidase is not produced.
Lysine- and ornithine-decarboxylase-negative.
Gluconate is not oxidized.
Selenite is not reduced.
The following compounds are used as sole carbon and energy sources: aesculin, raffinose, salicin, and glycerol.

The following compounds are not used as sole carbon and energy sources: d-arabinose, d-fucose, melezitose, melibiose, ribose, starch, trehalose, butanol, dulcitol, ethanol, methanol, propanol, xylitol, benzoate, hippurate, tartrate and valerate.
The following compounds are used as sole carbon, nitrogen and energy sources: glutamine, l-methionine, l-threonine and tryptophan.
The following compounds are not used as sole carbon, nitrogen and energy sources: aspartate, l-cysteine and phenylalanine.
Resistant to cephalothin (30 μg), kanamycin (30 μg), erythromycin (15 μg), neomycin (10 μg), nalidixic acid (30 μg), rifampicin (30 μg), bacitracin (10 units) and novobiocin (30 μg).
Sensitive to sulfamethoxazole/trimethoprim (23.75/1.25 μg).
Contains ubiquinone 9 as the major quinone (69 %) and minor amounts of ubiquinone 10 (23 %) and ubiquinone 8 (9 %).
The polar lipids comprise phospholipids, aminolipids and phosphoglycolipids.
The type strain is CG4.1T (=CECT 5903T =LMG 23626T).
